sn7.3:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
sn7.3:4.2: The brahmin Bharadvāja the Fiend heard a rumor to the effect that:
sn7.3:4.3: “A brahmin of the Bharadvāja clan has gone forth from the lay life to homelessness in the presence of the ascetic Gotama!” Angry and displeased he went to the Buddha
sn7.3:4.4: and abused and insulted him with rude, harsh words.
sn7.3:4.5: But when he said this, the Buddha kept silent.
sn7.3:4.6: Then Bharadvāja the Fiend said to the Buddha:
sn7.3:6.1: When you get angry at an angry person
sn7.3:6.2: you just make things worse for yourself.
sn7.3:6.3: When you don’t get angry at an angry person
sn7.3:6.4: you win a battle hard to win.
sn7.3:7.1: When you know that the other is angry,
sn7.3:7.2: you act for the good of both
sn7.3:7.4: if you’re mindful and stay calm.
sn7.3:9.1: When he had spoken, Bharadvāja the Fiend said to the Buddha:
sn7.3:9.4: And Venerable Bhāradvāja became one of the perfected.
